project.teaser: PALIMPSEST takes inspiration from the original meaning of the Greek word παλίμψηστος (palimpsestos, ‘again’ + ‘scrape’), which describes the process of the writing practices over papyrus: existing text was scraped and washed off, the surface re-smoothed, and...
project.objective: PALIMPSEST takes inspiration from the original meaning of the Greek word παλίμψηστος (palimpsestos, ‘again’ + ‘scrape’), which describes the process of the writing practices over papyrus: existing text was scraped and washed off, the surface re-smoothed, and the new literary material written on the saved material. PALIMPSEST adopts this re-writing perspective and grounds it on a living heritage approach. PALIMPSEST envisages regenerating the lost “sustainability wisdom” underlying the production of heritage landscapes through the activation of co-creation processes involving creative actors, technical stakeholders and civic society. Here architecture, design and art practices will dialogue with place-specific needs and broad systemic challenges to imagine new scenarios and experiment with innovative practices connecting human actions, landscape heritage and sustainability objectives. Such experiments will envision novel Landscape Scenarios aiming at producing dedicated Landscape Services, inspired by the generation of beneficial outcomes on ecosystem functions, which the creative contribution of CCIs will empower. Human practices will arise as relevant agents of a new sustainable palimpsest process. PALIMPSEST will integrate the aforementioned Landscape Services in environmental-sensitive solutions with sustainable finance infrastructures to support the sharing and circulating of positive externalities at different levels among the landscape service actors and communities. PALIMPSEST revolves around three pilots with strong cultural identities and relevant environmental problems: Lodz (PL), a UNESCO city of films fighting the highest air pollution levels in Europe; Milan fringes (IT), traditional agricultural landscapes struggling with unsustainable water use; Jerez de la Frontera (ES), an Andalusian wine landscape and vernacular site challenged by renewable energy production facilities.
project.title: CREATIVE DRIVERS FOR SUSTAINABLE LIVING HERITAGE LANDSCAPES
project.keywords: Landscape services, Living landscapes, Sustainable practices, Hybrid prototyping

article.title: Creative minds support sustainable landscapes
article.teaser: An EU-backed project is seeking artists, designers and architects across Europe who are keen to conceptualise and experiment on new approaches that will help reshape landscapes.

article.title: Recommendations for secure and sustainable European cultural landscapes
Using culture to breathe new life into historic city centres
Providing nature-based solutions for landscape sustainability
New life to age-old paper reuse method

result.title: Dissemination and communication plan
result.description: D5.1 presents the dissemination and communication strategy including the toolbox and the identified list of tools to be developed ad hoc for the scope and integrating the prototyping components.

result.title: Activating key principles of systemic design through exploratory prototyping

details.authors: Maria Vitaller del Olmo Aalborg University (Copenhagen), Denmark Nicola Morelli Aalborg University (Copenhagen), Denmark Amalia De Götzen Aalborg University (Copenhagen), Denmark Luca Simeone Aalborg University (Copenhagen), Denmark

result.title: PALIMSEST repository
result.description: The PALIMPSEST repository will serve as a database of the knowledge developed in the project. Data visualizations, information related to physical installations and temporary performances, as well as videos, images and narratives, AR and VR content and other applications will be saved and accessed here from relevant stakeholders.

result.title: Palimpsest concept and policy guidelines (1st)
result.description: D1.2 presents an advanced version of the PALIMPSEST concept and early policy guidelinesaimed at supporting WP2, WP3, WP4 and WP5 implementation.

result.title: Landscape as palimpsest: literature and case studies
result.description: D1.1 reports the most important findings of tasks 1.1, 1.2, 1.3 out of literature review and case study. This deliverable will also include the results of the mapping of key landscape architecture norms and regulation across EU countries as well as a set of relevant examples and initiatives

result.title: Residential workshop: report (1st)
result.description: D2.2 reports the work carried out during the the first cycle of the residential workshops following the results of the creative dialogues.

result.title: Assessment plan and guidelines
result.description: D4.1 presents the assessment framework and includes guidelines for its collaborative implementation. It will also collect different tools to be adopted and used by the project partners, especially the pilots throughout the project implementation.

result.title: Creative Dialogues: the report
result.description: D2.1 reports the entire Creative Dialogues process till the identification of the team selected for the best Landscape architecture proposal. It includes the work done for the preparation of the procedure, the procedural documents, the report of the dialogues, the collected proposals, the report of the evaluation work.

category.title: environmental sciences
category.displayCode: /natural sciences/earth and related environmental sciences/environmental sciences

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
